text:
Alkohol:  7,5% obj. 
 Kolor:  Czarny, nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Beżowa, drobnoziarnista, umiarkowana.
Wygląda trochę jak pianka na cappuccino. Nie jest zbyt okazała, szybko redukuje się do nikłej obrączki, która pozostaje na cały czas degustacji.
Niewiele pajęczynek na ściankach szkła. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest bardzo skromny. W pierwszej chwili dociera do nosa lekka paloność, odrobina ciemnych słodów, czekolada mleczna i kawa rozpuszczalna.
Troszeczkę z tyłu przypieczona skórka od chleba i odrobina karmelu. 
 Smak:  Piwo otrzymałem w wyniku wymiany piwnej. Trudno określić datę butelki, bo nigdzie jej nie ma;( Obstawiam po profilu piwa, że trochę przeleżakowało.
Leżakowanie spowodowało, że zatracił się mleczny profil piwa.
Jest sporo nut kawy, gorzkiej czekolady, dość wysoka paloność. Pojawia się też śliskość na języku i kremowe odczucie w ustach. Brakuje tej najważniejszej cechy, czyli mlecznej słodyczy.
Pojawia się odrobina orzechów włoskich i karmelu. Struktura jest umiarkowana, gładkie na języku.
Lekkie, umiarkowanie pijalne, niskowysycone. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:   

Taki sobie mleczny stout. 
Tak jak wcześniej zaznaczyłem leżakowanie odebrało mu mleczną słodycz, 
a spowodowało, że stało się bardziej palone, wytrawne. Aromat także stracił bardzo na sile. 
Osobiście jestem fanem słodkich, mocno mlecznych Milk Stoutów. 
Niemniej jednak piwo jest gładkie i kremowe na języku.
Niskie wysycenie ułatwia jego konsumpcje.
Good stuff, not the syrupy sweet but the balanced and oily style I like, some depth and body, chocolaty, a bit on the milk chocolate side. Enjoyed it.
Dark black body, brown head, some lacing. Aroma of roast cocoa and lactose. Taste is actually more on the bitter roasty side than a typical cream or sweet stout. Decent.

schenkt zwart als olie met mooie dikke volle bruine kraag. aroma van koffie, chocolade, geroosterde mout. Smaken van koffie, licht zuurtje in de basis, geroosterde en gebrande mouten, chocolademout. volle body

A pitch black appearance with a tan head perty! The aroma contains some dark chocolate, licorice, espresso, and vanilla. The flavor is well balanced with some sweet chocolate notes and some bitter coffee notes. The aftertaste is slightly bitter. This is a damn good stout!

Zwart bier met bruine schuimkraag. Geur: geroosterde mout, koffie, chocolade, cacao. Smaak: geroosterde mout bitterheid, hopbitterheid, chocolade, en licht zoet wat een mooie smaak balans oplevert. Volmondig en romig mondgevoel. Matige tot medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: mout en hopbitterheid en wat restsuiker. Lekker!

Keg at the Beer Gonzo tap room, 04/02/17.
Black with a decent tan cap.
Nose is chocolate, light roast, spice, burnt toffee, light lactic nip.
Taste comprises milk chocolate biscuits, fruit rinds, vanilla, roasted brown sugar, light roast, dark maltings.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Aroma: Chocolate, coffe, sweet roast, cherry Appearance: Black, no see through, creamy liver color head, lingering lace medium Taste: Coffee, chocolate, roast, licorice

Bottle, 0.355l. Pours pitch black color with thin totally diminishing deep brown head and without any lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, lactose, dried fruit and herbs. Taste starts with medium sweet rich roasted malt and licorice, follows by sour herbal note, nuts, caramel, chocolate and mild fruitiness, mouthfeel is smooth and warming, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture and lively carbonation in palate. Milk chocolate and coffee bomb...
Keg at Beer Gonzo; black pour with a creamy tan head, aroma has sweet milk chocolate, taste has creamy milk chocolate, vanilla, hint of latte coffee.

Draft at Beer Gonzo taproom opening night 27/01/17.
Poured Black, tan head. Creamy chocolate, milk, vanilla, cocoa Roasty. Swet, smooth, flavoursome solid Stout.
Bottled. A black beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of chocolate, malt, caramel, spice and bitterness.

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a pitch black with a medium sized tan head. Aroma has roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, light lactose, more ssweet licorice. Taste is sweet, roasty bitter, chocolaty and with a hint of salmiak or "sysmofytter". Medium full body and an average low carbonation.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Fajne. Bardzo gładkie, kremowe, sporo mlecznej czekolady, przyjemnej paloności.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Zwart met donkerbruine schuimkraag die wat inzakt. G: Koffie, cacao, geroosterde mout en lactose. S: Zoete aanzet, beetje lactose, donker fruit en chocolade. Geroosterde moutbitterheid in de afdronk. M: Volmondig, medium carbonatie en licht sticky.

Pours dark brown, almost black, with light brown foamy head. Aroma: lactose, malt notes, which takes on toasted, coffee, chocolate and hint of roasted. Flavor is practically the same, supported also with dark (stone) fruits esters, which takes on blueberries, plums, prunes. Finish is slightly dry. Body is medium, texture creamy, carbo is medium.
Bottle. Dark colour. High, stable, beige head. The aroma is sweet, with roasty notes of chocolate. The taste is very similar with bitter dark chocolate or cocoa. Very drinkable.

On tap at Hopcat. Pours black with dark lacing. Lots of roasty nutty flavor in this milk stout. Almost too much for me for this style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black with brown foam. Aroma: burnt, coffee, chocolate, a little hop, brandy and ice-cream. Taste: velvety, caramel, roasted, coffee with cream, ice cream.

On tap at RCBW 2016. Dark browne, almost black liquid. Modest beige head. Dark chocolate, hints of coffee, hints of vanilla, light nutiness in the aroma. Beginning is rather bitter. Hints of cocoanibs and chocolate. Nutiness. Bitter roasted coffee beans in the middle. Slightly spicy, very chocolaty finish. Rather medium bodied, quite well drinkable stout. Tasty, but without surprises.
As the name hints - it is creamy and quite viscose. Hints of coffee, vanilla, cream. Very nice stout

Sample from draft at fermentoren. Yet black with a big mocha head. Nose of sweet bakers chocolate, oats, lactose sweetness, roast, vanilla Cream, light nuts, and marshmallow sweetness. Taste is sweet and creamy. Enjoyable sweetness
Nice sweet aroma of nuts and chocolate, cocao and roasted malts. Full body sweet , light bitterness. long roasted finish. Delicious

A good stout overall. Pours a very nice inky black with a thick brown head. Smells of milk and a bit of chocolate. Taste is smooth, sweet and creamy, with milk and a bit of bitter chocolate in the finish. Had in the bottle.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are chocolate and some coffee. Very creamy.
Pours black. Zero head. Smells roasty. Roasty flavor with only a hint of lactose if you search for it. A bit astringent more in line with a porter.
Pours a dark black color with a roasted malt aroma. Taste is toasty, roasted nut and chocolate. Easy drinking stout, with a creamy coating on the tongue after the swallow.
Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, cream, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, cream, some black licorice.

12 oz bottle. Black color with small beige head that dissipates completely. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts. Taste is coffee, more roasted malts, freshness from the lactic character, a hint of tartness, slightly bitter finish.

Another really good stout from DH. Pours deep dark brown with small one finger head. Quickly diminishes to no lace at all. Nice coffee and milk chocolate flavors with a sweet finish. Bit thin and extremely low carb at this age. Good coffee aroma. This rating is for a bottle opened after > 1 yr of cellaring.

Aroma is coffee, chocolate, dark/roasted malts and a hint of dark fruit. The flavor is coffee, chocolate/dark chocolate, dark fruit/mild sweetness and a mix of a acidity and slight tartness in the finish.

Aroma: roast coffee, dark chocolate
Appearance: black with beige head
Taste: smooth, dark chocolate, aftertaste bitterness

Bottle at Laundromat, january 20th 2015. Black body, small tanned head. Aroma is mildly roasted with chocolate. Taste is bitter, dark cocoa, fruity, with a rather thin body. Lasting bitterness combined with a sweet finish.

Aroma full of chocolate, roasted malts and a little caramel. 
Pours black, creamy one finger head. 
Pretty sweet and light bitterness. 
Very easy drinking sweet stout that has a good amount of roasted, creamy chocolate to it. 
Body is medium to full, soft carbonation and a rounded roasted finish. 
Good.

It is an average stout. I take an observation from another and if I compare with others it is missing something. We could say a bit watery but it is a good one. Nice black color and thin foam. The coffee is present typical from stout. It could be a bit stronger with more characters. It could be a nice stout to begin the night.
Looks like motor oil. No head. No lacing. Somewhat sweet. Milk taste but not creamy. Needs something more (vanilla? Coconut?) Tasted at Elijah Ps.

Ich kann mit diesen ganzen Stouts nicht viel anfangen. Viel Schärfe und eine starke Schwere bedingt durch den ganzen Alkohol. Dahinter etwas Milch, Zucker und Kaffee. Ganz nett, aber definitiv nicht meins.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep black colour with a smooth body and smooth head. Aroma of roasted malt, milk coffee and chocolate. Taste of black coffee, cream, milk, chocolate, dark bread, woods and plums. Intense and delicious.

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with small, light brown head. Definetely milk chocolate aroma along with some caramel and light coffee notes. Taste is semi-sweet (milk, biscuity). Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation finish is slightly bitter. In general solid stout, not even very boring. Wotyh trying.

Cerveza de color negro muy oscuro con una cabeza de color marrón.
Aroma con notas de malta tostada, café y chocolate dulce.
Sabor dulce a chocolate con leche, malta tostada y algo de café. La sensación es un poco seca, pero tiene un buen cuerpo con la lactosa. Esta cerveza tiene una buena proporción entre los sabores de la lactosa dulce y maltas tostadas. Es también bastante fácil de beber con un poco de amargura en el acabado. Sabrosa.
Dark black color with creamy head. Malty aroma. Malt, chocolate and some dark fruit in the taste.

dark, malty, roasted with dark cocoa just lingered in. great beer from the dark beer masters. spicy nose that tells you what you are going to get. creamy enough.

Pours pitch black, long lasting mocha brown foam.

Bready, sweet, malty and hints of chocolate in the nose.

Roasted and sharp at first. Smoothes into a rounder finish. Subtle hints of wood. Long lasting flavors of oak and chocolate lingers.

Kindly shared by Jaghana. Couleur noire, mousse qui disparait. Nez chocolat noirs, cremeux, note toffee et alcool. Gout malt légèrement grillé, café, chocolat et alcool, on sent le lactose et les notes cremeuses, notes aussi de réglisse. Bien balancée et intense. Fin longue grillée et réglisse.

Bottle 355ml, a dark beer with low head. Nose is on dark chocolate, coffee and licorice. Aroma is a creamy dark chocolate, smooth body, dark coffee notes, intense malty notes, lot of roasted malt but very balanced, powerful for this alcohol level, licorice touch, plum hints, well done.
Poured a dark reddish brown, minimal beige head. Aroma of cocoa, coffee and roast malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, medium sweet, lightly bitter.

Aroma coffee, chocolate, roasty, 
Appearance black, brown foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, 
Overall a really nice mouthfeel and great coffee taste. I would suggest this beer to a friend
Pours a dark black with a beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate and coffee. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Has a roasted malt flavor with cocoa and chocolate. not very bitter

Nice nearly black color, with small creamy head. Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, roasty, bready and a bit sour. Maybe in background some kind of resin and forest honey. Taste, at first is very smooth and roasty then You can feel good quality esspresso with cream. Aftertaste is a bit alcolic and sour from roasted malts. Body is full, medium carbonated and oily but not very sweet. Bitterness is not too big but it has resin finnish. Very nice beer which tastes similar to Irish coffe.

Draught. Pitch black, cream head. Aroma of dark choclate, caramel, coffee. In taste sweet, creamy with lots of dark chocolate. Low diacetyl adds nice butterscotch. Medium bodied, very smooth. Great stout.

Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, latte, chocolate. Flavor is roasted, fireplace, ashes, light bitter
 and light to medium sweet.
Bottle. Dark pour, brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted coffee and caramelised malt. Taste has roasted coffee, gritty cacao, hopbitters and a creamy mouthfeel. Very nice.
Black with dark, creamy coffee coloured head. Aroma and flavour have elements of a sweetened, milky coffee. Maybe a bit of liquorice in the taste too.

Pitch black color with a small head. The beer has an aroma comparable to milk coffee. Lots of milk in it though. Also ashtray and nuts. The flavor is black chocolate, dairy and a bit harsh ashtray in the aftertaste. After couple of sips ashtray is a bit overwhelming. Still the lactose making it a bit more smooth. Its a nice stout overall.

Pitch black with almost dark brown foam. The smell resembles smoked coffee. The taste has a heavy character with little sweetness and huge amounts of malt, again with lots of smoked coffee. The aftertaste has dry smoked coffee in it.

To taki RIS dla opornych. Piwo które tak dobrze naśladuje bogatszy gatunek stouta, że naprawdę można się nabrać. Bardzo bogate, czekoladowe, drapiące w podniebienie i nos a jednocześnie niezwykle pijalne

330ml bottle @Beerfox, Riga. Pitch black color. Small size, brown head, stays. Roasted malts, sweet, chocolate, faint biscuits and smokiness in aroma. Sweet, roast, milky, chocolate in taste. Long lasting chocolate malts in aftertaste. Carbonation is tad too high, but still quite drinkable.

Nero profondo, che non lascia trasparire niente; una testa di schiuma importante, di color kaki e dalla buona persistenza. Al naso malto tostato, torrecatto di caffè, cioccolato. In bocca polvere di caffè, un deciso attacco di cacao poco addomesticato al palato, una ruvidezza scontrosa allinizio che poi si trasforma in un finale più mallebaile. Calorosa di alcool, asciutta e tostata, quasi bruciata, ottima beverinità.
Bottle. Pitch black pour with no head whatsoever. Loads and loads of milk chocolate, light roast, vanilla fudge and some caramel. Carbonation is completely flat.

Dokładnie to, czego oczekuję od cream stouta: gładkość, kawka, lekka paloność, odrobinka słodkości. Tyle że w tej kategorii Dukla wypuściła znacznie tańszą Małą Czarną, więc można spokojnie zejść w te rejony cenowe, bo jakość podobna - niewiele słabiej w wypadku Dukli. Ale tylko niewiele.

7/VI/15 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2015-760)  
Clear dark brown to black beer, fizzy aery crackling brown head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of roasted smell, coffee, charcoal, some dried fruits, dusty. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sourish start, little sweet, very roasted, some dried fruits, overripe banana, coffee, cocoa powder. Aftertaste: charcoal, pretty bitter, some overripe fruits, bit spicy, liquorice, some aniseed.

Aroma: full of lactose, roasted malts, bitter chocolate, coffee, dried fruits.
Appearance: deep black color, almost brown head.
Taste: low bitterness, roasted malts, coffee, very smooth, ashy, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, smooth roasted finish.
Overall: Really smooth milk stout, not too sweet, nicely roasted and balanced.
On tap at Erzbierschof Züri. Pours very dark. Roasty coffee aroma, chocolate too. Quite sweet for a stout, but still a lot of coffee taste.
Pours black with small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, strong coffee. Taste is medium sweet with dark malts acidity and low bitterness. Medium body and low carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 Po przelaniu do szkła powstaje sycząca, błyskawicznie opadająca brązowa piana, która po kilku dosłownie sekundach znika do zera. Barwa niemalże czarna, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie kawa zbożowa, latte, cola i likier kawowy. Pojawia się też oczywiście nieprzyjemna lekka siareczka od laktozy. W smaku mocno palone, dymione, sporo gorzkiej czekolady, świeżo mielonej kawy. Nie jest zbyt słodkie, lekko likierowe, goryczka spora jak na Sweet Stouta, za to wysycenie stanowczo zbyt wysokie, po raz kolejny przypomina colę. W afterteasie nieprzyjemna laktoza, palone kable i rozgrzewający alkohol. 
Bardzo intensywny w odbiorze Sweet Stout, wyraziście palony i gorzki przez co bliżej mu do wersji imperialnej niż delikatnej, sesyjnej. Niestety brak tu trochę ciała, beznadziejna piana i niezbyt przyjemny aromat psują odbiór całości.

Strong roasted coffee and chocolate aromas; a bit of smoke. Some generalized bitterness.

Color is very dark brown, nearly black. Very slight tan head.

Somewhat sweet taste; coffee bitterness taste.

Body is full; texture is creamy; carbonation average; finish is long and bitter, and a bit sweet, starts with coffee then moves on to chocolate.

Overall a good stout; I like the smoky roasted coffee and chocolate with a bit of sweets.
Pours black with small beige head. Aroma of deep roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and hops. Taste follows the aroma-- sweet and bitter. Medium bodied.
Pretty good beer. A lot of roasted chocolate getting trough, and the mouthfeel is great. But for me it misses a small boost for sure. Needs something (subtile) extra.
Black, medium beige head. Chocolate and sweet roastines on the nose. Sweet, roasty full-bodied beer, with strong notes of chocolate. Like a sweet.
Sample. Black with beige head. Coffee and lactose aroma. Taste is similar, ends dry and with more coffee. Enjoyable.
Creamy dark beer with small head. Chocolate and roasted aroma. Milky chocolate finish.

355 mL bottle. Pours just about as close to black as a beer can get. Medium dark brown head. Lots of roast in the nose, along with some semi-sweet cocoa, and maybe a little brown sugar. The flavour is sweet chocolate, milk up front, followed by roast, and then a little bitterness. Lingers nicely. Good body. Solid brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, string chocolate, coffee, cocoa and espresso. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, medium bitter, hop, medium sweet, espresso, little vanilla, little liquorice and notes of smoke.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 Bottle 12 fl. oz., Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Czarne, mętne piwo o ciemnobeżowej, puszystej pianie i bardzo przyjemnym, czekoladowym aromacie. W smaku gęste, kremowe, mleczne, intensywne i wytrawne, czekoladowe, lekko palone z łagodną ale wyrazista goryczką na finiszu.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours pitch black with a fading creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, milk chocolate, cocoa. Flavor is light sweet, malty, coffee, lactose, chocolate, little dark fruit, raisin. Medium body, just a tad overcarbonated. 190415

(on tap at BGM2, sample) BLack untransparent colour. Small, brown, medium fast falling head. Medium to full body, low carbonation, smooth and creamy texture. Sweet, lactose, sunflower seed, coffee,dark and milk chocolate. Taste: Medium sweet to sweet, a bit sour, lactose, dark chocolate. Long, moderate bitter, chocolate finish. Very tasty.
Dark brown with medium dark beige/ light brown head. Coffee aroma. Good roasted bitterness with remarkable coffee and vanilla notes.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus. Opaque pitch black color, average sized light brown head. Smell and taste malts, liquorice, some roast, a little chocolate, chocolate milk. Roasted malts are there for sure. Pretty roasty and intense. Hard to describe sometimes.

Bottle @ benzai. Pitch black with a darl brown head. Smells roasty, dark malts, chocolate, coffee, a slight hint of liquorice. Nice. Tastes loads of salty liquorice, wiebertjes, roasty, coffee. Full body, soft to medium carbo.
roasty aroma with hints of chocolate. appear black with a fine brown head. taste medium bitter, with a light hint of sweetness, light mouthfeel, with a creamy texture, light bitter aftertaste

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. A decent milk stout

Pours a black beer with a small beige head. 
Smells of chocolate, coffee, hint of sweetness also.
Tastes malty bitter.
Leaves a nice roasted bitterness with a hint of sweetness. 

Okay beer but nothing specially exciting.
Pours black with tan head. Aroma is sweet coffee, kind of sugary. Its got coffee with creamer, smoke and roast. I like this alot, perfect balance between all the different things going on.
solid stout not too sweet...nice dark berry and coffee taste...really flavorful...i will buy again....(#427)...

On tap at Haute Dish. Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has dark grains backed by some creamy chocolate and a bit of roasted malts. Flavor has notes of creamy dark grains and chocolate with a bit of roast underlying.

Very nice beer. Sharp roast aroma with some subtle dark chocolate and a little cream sense. The latter really comes out in the texture, especially, Pours black with mocha head and lacing. Finish is pretty bitter. Thick consistency, soft carbonation. Bottle.

355 mL bottle. Pours just about as close to black as a beer can get. Medium dark brown head. Lots of roast in the nose, along with some semi-sweet cocoa, and maybe a little brown sugar. Quite appealing. So far so good. The flavour is sweet chocolate milk up front, followed by roast, and then a little bitterness. Lingers nicely. Good body. Solid brew.
Czarne nieprzejrzyste. W aromacie czekolada, kakao. W smaku mleczna czekolada, z palona kontra.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours in black body with medium creamy tan head. Aroma is roasty, nutty, caramel, light cocoa. Taste has higher roasty bitterness with balanced roasty sweetness, long lasting bready bitterness. Little bit astringent in the background. Body is creamy, full, medium to high carbonation.

Piana tworzy się z niechęcią, jest brązowa i szybko redukuje się do obrączki. Piwo ma nieprzejrzyście czarną barwę.
Aromat intensywny, zdominowany mleczną czekoladą i słodkim kakao - takim rozpuszczalnym, które mama robiła na śniadanie. Gdzieś tam na chwilę nasze nozdrza muskają orzechy i subtelny sos sojowy. 
W smaku początek wydaje się być lekko słodki, coś jakby słodzone kakao. Jednak już za chwilę pojawia się kwaskowa, wytrawna, mocna kawa i bardzo delikatne nuty palone. Goryczka jest niemal niewyczuwalna. Każdy łyk pozostawia w ustach posmak kakao 100% w proszku (takie Decomorreno). Piwo jest pełne i gładkie.

Tap @ Taphouse. Black with light brown head. Aroma of cocoa, coffee and roasted malts. Sweet malt flavour at first with a burned malty bitterness among the well balanced hoppy notes. Has a solid body with enough carbonation to avoid it becoming cloy. Highly drinkable and very pleasant.

Wyczuwalne jest te? palon?? z lekk? owocowo?ci?. W smaku przyjemna palono??. Mimo to piwo nie jest zbyt bogate. Jest te? taka s?onawa palono??. Bardzo zwyk?y stout. Piwo dosy? przeci?tne. Poprawne ale bardzo proste.

Bottle. Pours near black in color with a beige head. Cocoa powder, notes of burnt wood and milk chocolatey sweetness in aroma. Feels quite smooth and creamy. Bitter chocolate, some coffee and sweet notes in taste. Later on also some campfire vibes are present. On the whole quite tasty, with a nice mix between both roasted and sweeter flavors.

Black with mocha head. Mouthfeel is medium with medium carbonation. Smells coffee and malts. Tastes of coffee with roasted malts. Decent black stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: fulsome, almost black, creamy tan head.  Aroma: roasty coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, toffee.  Taste: coffee and crème fraiche, light vanilla, bittersweet chocolate, hint of chalk.  Finish: smooth and nicely dry, with just a hint of chocolate sweetness. Notes: Wonderful milk stout. Full palate. Not overly sweet. Bottle from Total Wine in McLean, VA.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2015  March 6, 2015. Bottle at home, 
Black with a creamy, quickly dissipating, brown head. Aroma is roasted with char.coffee and some milk chocolate.Taste is light sweet, bitter roasted char notes.
Medium bodied, small bubble carbonation, not as creamy as expected.

Great aroma of coffee with milk and sugar. Its combined with aroma of chocolate and very dark bread. The beer is pitch black, with tanned, creamy head. In taste its mostly coffee, dark malts, a bit of chocolate. Aftertaste is dominated by bitterness. Its not very huge, but still strict and all-out. Beer is not very sweet at all. Mouth feel is good. Its very creamy and velvety. But I was hoping for something more thick and dense. In overall its great beer, but still not the perfect one.

Pours a viscous-looking, close to black body with a small, medium brown head that laces the glass well. Sweet, malty, roasted and strong aroma of dark caramel, dark chocolate and a touch of generic fruits. Strong flavour of dark caramel and chocolate, with coffee, fruits, vanilla and ash in the back, all encapsulated in a lactic whole. Moderate sweet and moderate bitter taste. Mid-bodied, oily and smooth texture, soft carbonation. Splendid! 
[33 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

The name says it all! Too Cream! This is one of my top five favorite stouts. Very smith and creamy. Just a hint of smokiness. Just great!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great coffeey.w sweet chocolat and some nice light dark malts... medium sweet bitter body... hard carbs long coffee malty finish... great stout

From bottle. Pours black with a small dark beige head and little to no lacing on the glass. Aroma is chocolate and roasted malts. Taste has a gentle sweetness, chocolate, roasted malts, and only a hint of bitterness from the hops. Creamy medium mouthfeel. This is a delicious and easy to drink stout.

Draught at Delirium Hop Loft. Black beer with à nice beige head. Aroma from cocoa powder, milk chocolate, licorice, hops, dark fruits. Metal and tar flavor, soot, peat, quite roasted, coffee, sourish notes. Coffee finish, some peat.

Draught at Delirium Café Hoppy Lof, Brussels. Black with small beige head. Intense milk chocolate aroma upfront, some coffee and gunpowder along with sweet liquorice. Medium bodied, low carbonation. Semi sweet, low bitterness. A bit one-dimensional, and quickly lose interest in my glass.

15 cl. draft thx to ajax25g @ Delirium Hoppy Loft // appearance is standard black with creamy, nicely lacing mocha head // smell is sweet, dark malts, mocha, milk chocolate, touch of very light roast, coffee & definitive presence of lactose // taste along the line with sweet lactose, mocha, chocolate  milk, coffee, candy, very light roast, touch dark fruits, milk chocolate, hint of sweet liquorish & brief touch hops in the back // body is creamy, smooth & lactose // quite nice

12oz bottle courtesy of alexsdad to complete my ratings of the Dark Horse stouts. thanks, Brad! pours a silky, rich, black capped by a thick, very dark, mocha head that leaves slivers of lace around the edges. aroma is great and really reminds me of a creamy, mocha milkshake with notes of dark chocolate, cream, and roasted beans backed by a touch of smoke. flavor is wonderful as well rich, dark chocolate, roasted malts, black coffee, and a touch of cream backed by hints of mocha latte, vanilla, toffee candy, and wet earth. palate is smooth, creamy, and rich without being overbearing and finishes dry, roasted, and semi-sweet. overall, another great stout from Dark Horse.

Bottles shared with Damico in celebration of Radiohead.  Pours a dark color with off white foam head.  Aroma of vanilla and mocha caramel.  Milk chocolate notes with a nice roasty nuttiness underneath and some milk sugar notes.  Damn tasty.  Creamy.

Pours dark black with about a 1 in. dark brown head. The head dissipates somewhat quickly and leaves a nice lacing on the glass. There is a sweet, roasted chocolate aroma. I also get a hint of vanilla and coffee as well on the aroma. It tastes very much like it smells. Roasted chocolate is very apparent as well as that sweetness from the milk sugar. Coffee and chocolate flavor really do last. There is some bitterness at the end, but it counteracts the sweetness nicely. I would imagine that this would be great on nitro pour. Overall a good beer.

Pours unclear black coffee with a nice dark mocha cinnamon head. The aroma brings the milk sugar for sure with some chocolate notes umderlying. The body is creamy and delicious, perfect. The flavor brings the sweet lactose and frist, then some creamy milk chocolate, and end with a decent lighter roasted profile.
Thick, dark head recedes quickly. Huge roasted malt aromas, slight bittersweet aftertaste almost coffee-like. Smooth, creamy, oily texture. Although a bit heavy for a Florida night (obviously).

Strong cream and alcohol aroma with even stronger taste.  Black appearance with a simple mouthfeel but big aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, dark black pour with thin tan head, aroma brings sweet lactose, caramel, slight chocolate, milk chocolate, espresso and mocha notes, hints of dark fruits in there as well.  Taste is sweet lactose, a sharp acidic note with some dark fruits, toffee, hints of coffee and roast, finishing fairly sweet.  Eh.
Pours deep black with a mocha head.  Aroma is dark chocolate and espresso.  Taste is sweet with a tart bitterness.  Smooth mouth feel, excellent.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Black with a big dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, hard roasted malt and a little vanilla. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Smooth and oily. 250412

Originally reviewed: 2/10/11. 12oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours an uber-thick evil-looking black. This slowly glugs out of the bottle. No head at all, just a ring around the edge. Not the prettiest of beers, but man to I love that thick pour. The nose is full of coffee and chocolate, some dry notes like burlap and wood. Not as sweet as I would think. 

Excellent mouth on this one. Big chewy feel with a smooth coating effect. Excellent for this style. I wish all stouts would take note and do the same. This isnt the sweetest of Sweet Stouts, but its still a good one. Dark chocolate, roasted coffee, slight acidity, and the faintest of wood notes on the back end. Good, easy-drinking stout here. The alcohol gets to me near the end though, so its not necessarily an everyday beer. I love me some thick stouts, so Im glad I have some more bottles of this
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 At fountainhead. Smooth creamy and rich but not overly so. Flourless chocolate cake-like. Serving: Tap

Pours a pitch black with a medium to thinner brown head.  Aroma consists of chocolate, toffee, and a bit of raisin.  It is quite potent and very sweet.  Taste is on the sweeter side as well.  The tastes of raisin does not continue into the flavor.  It is mostly chocolate, but a hint of toffee can still be noticed.  Medium body, fairly creamy, with a bit of carbonation.  Light chocolate aftertaste.

On tap @ Beer Temple. Color is black, head is beige, creamy. Aromas: Coffee, coffee and coffee, plus roast and just a hint of lactose and fruit. Flavor is light sweet, roasted, a little fruity, coffee. Body is a bit thin, bit fuller would have made this truly great. Finishes medium bitter and roasted, quite dry. Still very nice.

Draft at Beer temple! Black color with a
Beige head that not keep a lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, smoked wood. Taste is bitter with notes of roasted malt, bitter chocolate and coffee. Mouthfeel is awesome and long keeping a smoked bitterness feeling. Very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone 4S

Aroma- dark sugar, milk, caramel, chocolate
Appearance- pitch black, minimal head, a black hole of a beer
Taste- milk chocolate, whipped cream, caramel sweetness
Palate- decent body, silky smooth mouthfeel
Overall- Solid brew here from a great brewery in Dark Horse.  Very sweet, classic cream stout.

Black with a very dark head.  Aroma is very sweet, milky, caramelized sugar, vanilla, lightly roasted malt, and almost a little light bourbon.  Flavor has nice lactose, dark caramelized sugar, vanilla, roast malts, cocoa.  Thinner than expected.  Finish has a light bittersweet tone from the malts.  If the body was a little fuller this would be even better.  Very good.

#1305 draught; nose is decent cream, little oak, velvet alcohol, mellow earth, decent roasted malt, feel is mediumwatery, carb is mediumlow, taste is good espresso, cream, some cake, weak cough syrup, the some cork

This thing is black. No light from yonder window breaks. There was a tiny bit of dark brown head, but it disappeared pretty quickly. Smells like sweet malt, milk, and woodiness. Taste is still woody, but not too sweet. some coffee, tons of roast. Somewhat hoppy. Not as thick as I thought it would be, but nice.

12oz bottle that has been in the cellar for at least a year.  Not many beers look better from the bottle to the glass.  Deep dark black pour with a chocolate brown head.  Aromas of chocolate and coffee on the nose.  Taste is creamy and smooth.  Quite enjoyable.
12 ounce bottle.  Poured black without any head. This is a little to sweet for me. There are nice chocolate and roasted malt notes. Some caramel notes round out this stout. A great beer.

On tap. Pours Black with some reddish hue when put up against the light. A very nice deep brown head. Aroma:  deep earthy roasted notes, savory notes, milk chocolate and bitter chocolate, you get the lactose, some dried fruity notes as well, light liquorice , and even some coffee. Taste: very creamy mouthfeel quite hard carbonation, nice! Taste, you get the salty savoury notes, lactose, some bitter roasted notes In the aftertaste, earthy notes, prunes, fig, dried fruits, chocolate, milky notes,  I think of  salty caramel, good one, dry somewhat chalky mouthfeel in the aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown/black with dark brown head.  Aroma and flavor really roasty with a hint of residual sweetness left by the lactose.   Thick smooth mouthfeel.  Pretty good stuff

Keg at The Craft Beer Co. Clerkenwell, London. Black with cream head. Intense husky chocolate flavour, dark but with sweetness in the background. Heavy in burnt, chocolate malts, it is lasting on the palate. Good stuff.

Dark Horse has done a mighty good job with this extremely dense and full-bodied milk cream stout. Too Cream takes the method of a new classic like Left Hands Milk Stout and amps up the ABV% and coffee/licorice/chocolate aromas and flavors, making it damn-near as good as the aforementioned beer. If you cant get it on tap, do yourself a favor and pour your bottle into a nice pint glass of some kind and admire the beautiful java head and enjoy immensely.
On tap @macche so good! Black head!!! wood and licorice taste and smell. Medium carbonation. Good job!

17/02/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (handpump). Nera, densa, quasi impenetrabile, schiuma fine color cappuccino, molto persistente. Al naso intense note di malti tostati, cioccolata fondente, caffè. In bocca ha un attacco dolce, cioccolatoso, quindi vira in un lungo e intenso finale amaro, molto persistente. Corpo medio, consistenza oleosa, carbonazione soft. Sorprendente.

Dark brown with a small tan head. Nose is cocoa, coffee, light lactose.  Flavor is lightly goaty, some more coffee, lots of sweet chcocolate.  Sorta chalky, ashy finish.  Have had some good and some bad bottles over the years.

Black, dark tan head.. aroma is rich, dark chocolate...taste is heavy on the chocolate, creamy and roasted coffee. Mouthfeel is oily, smooth............lot of vanilla going on with a wisp of licorice..very slightly bitter, but overall wonderful.
Black with a minimal coffee-brown head. Aroma is sweet (sugar). Taste is chocolate and coffee. Medium body (oily texture), nice carbonation

Deep, dark color with a brown head. Thick pour. Very nice and balanced roasty malt with cocoa and coffee, tempered with a bit of sweetness. Very smooth and not too burnt in the taste. A very good stout.

Draught at Ørsted Ølbar: Pitch black beer with a nice cappuccino-looking head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, smoke, bacon and slightly tar. Taste is medium sweet, with quite some coffee, a touch of cream, lingering bitterness. Creamy smooth texture, lovely rough edges. A very good milk oat stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a black body with a creamy brown head. Roasty, coffee, chocolate, very soft and smooth. Nice.

Poured into a snifter.

3.0 A: Black. About as black as it gets. Pour yielded only one finger of short lived frothy brown head. No lacing.

3.0 S: Soft, supple roastiness. Tangy lactose and semi-sweet chocolate. Not a lot going on here.

3.5 T: More power than the nose suggests. Moderate roastiness with a touch of char and smoke. Lactose and bittersweet chocolate in healthy proportions. Perhaps a touch of molasses. Not wildly complex, but good.

3.5 M: Heavier medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Reasonably creamy with a lightly bitter aftertaste.

3.5 D: Decent, but nothing to write home about.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-11-2012 21:25:33

12oz bottle.  Fairly dark pour, coffee color head.  Aromas are sugary sweet, slightly nutty, cocoa.  Palate is silky smooth, the cream is up front with a slight bitterness through the mid palate and a malty finish.  Fairly decent sweet stout, I felt as though it could have been creamier, but decent balance.

355mL thanks to mikem409. Pours essentially ink into the snifter generating an ominous, deep mocha to near red head. Fizzes out a little quickly and almost an acid like cut. Small lacing. Great SRM. Nose is quite green olive briny, decanting thankfully to some really rich sweet chocolate, ganache, chocolate donut, devils food cake. Saltwater and lemon remain. Taste is a little light up front moving to mild brine then chalk. Quite the ashy, thinner finish. Mild bitterness but still too much ash. My head hurts from so much cigarette ash.

2011 Bottling
Tasted on 1/11/12 from a 12oz bottle, thanks to Roonai.  Pours a completely opaque, nearly black, dark brown, with a very thick dark brown head that recedes fairly quickly to thin lacing.  The nose is dominated by nutty dark chocolate with freshly brewed, super dark, espresso grounds, and a very light touch of creamy sweetness.  The flavor is quite dry with the same nutty dark chocolate, and extremely dark espresso as the nose, with the creaminess contributing more to texture than to the flavor.  The body is full and, as previously mentioned, creamy, with just below average carbonation and a long nutty dark chocolate and espresso finish, and the alcoholic heat warming my belly.
A rich full bodied brew. Tons of chocolate sweetness but still a nice roasty bitterness.

12oz bottle. Pitch black color, a nice solid brown head. Fades to minimal, some ropes of lace. Lighter, crisp carbonation. I love the light bitter coffee taste here, very nice and roasty. Cream aroma more evident as this warms a bit more, but everything else about this beer is sharp enough to balance it out (I was worried this would be too creamy). Bitter and sweet... Yeah, its a sweet stout, but it might be a bit too sweet for me, particularly in the aftertaste. Thats my only knock on it. This would probably be much better enjoyed with a food of some kind.

12oz pour black as night with big dark brown head that lingered. Minimal lacing. The aroma os of coffee, chocolate and what I would say is mild licorice. The flavor is of coffee, mild chocolate malt and I get that light licorice on the back end and it sticks to your tongue. The roasted malts blend very well. The overall creamy texture is very good. Another great beer from this brewer.

Bottle. Pour is black with a small tan head which quickly fades, no lace. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, cream, light roast, tobacco. Taste is lightly bitter, roast, coffee, creamer. Palate is creamy, soft, roasty, lightly bitter finish. Very nice.

Roasted malt, some chocolate and coffee on the nose, it fills my snifter handsomely with two fingers of brown head.  The taste bears the scent, with well balanced sweetness and bitterness.  It is creamy in the mouth and medium bodied.  This is a thoroughly enjoyable cream stout, and more of a sipper at 8% than most.

Dense black pour with a darker mocha head. Nose is roasty, some chocolate, some coffee. Taste is pretty sweet with a nice bitter finish. Palate is velvety, slick, really nice and smooth like you expect with the lactose sugar. Michigan sure has some fine stouts, and this one is no different. Makes me want to get ahold of the others in the series from Dark Horse. This is fantastic. Way too easy to drink, so pace yourself and enjoy.
I dont care, until I have somthing better, this and the rest of the Dark Horse stouts are some of the best beers I have had. They are not hyped like crazy and cost $7 a 4-pack. YUM!
Very interesting beer. No head within seconds. Starts malty and toasty like a stout, develops milky and slightly hoppy. Surprisingly light body.

Pours opaque brown with no light penetrating through, thick dense dark brown head and incredible retention.  Aroma is deep roast, leather, cream, chocolate, coffee cake.  Taste is coffee cake, chocolate, syrup, licorice, smoke, roast.   Body is full, creamy, low carbonation, roasty sweet finish.  Overall, an insanely bold brew.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass.  This puppy is BLACK.  Very thin head,  not noticing much lacing on the glass either.  My nose might be out of whack tonight, but I dont smell much.  Great mouth feel that kind of hugs the lining of your mouth for a bit.  Not a bad beer at all,  and Im a big fan of milk stouts.  I tend to like mine a bit sweeter than this one...lots of roasted something in there darkens the flavor a bit for me....but otherwise a very good beer.  I would certainly buy this again.

Pitch, PITCH black coloured body with a thin deep dark brown head atop and no light coming through, only a faint raisiny purple colour. Aroma of roasted malt, oak, peat, alcohol, milk, mushrooms, meat, soy sauce and some strong pungent earth and nuts. Full-bodied; Deep roasty flavoured body with a lot of coffee, nuts, milk, alcohol, vanilla, cereal, oak, bourbon and almost everything else you can think of. Aftertaste is just as potent - a very strong roasted malt flavour with layers of cream, alcohol, oak, vanilla and cigars. Overall, a very strong beer - dont let the sweet stout category fool you - this is an imperial to me. A ton of great flavours, an amazing complexity, a small format bottle and a beer from Michigan - whats not to like! I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Merchants in Dearborn, Michigan on 16-January-2011 for US$2.29 sampled at home in Washington on 26-September-2011.

12oz bottle from Picks poured into an English Pint. Pours a dark black with zero head. Aroma of dark coffee and some slight hints of chocolate. Taste is lightly bitter. Kinda tastes like cold coffee, but in a good way. Light bodied with a thin texture. Zero carbonation and an average length, coffee-ish finish. Overall, not bad. Not my favorite stout but definitely drinkable.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Black with thin, but foamy, purplish-tan head and some bubbly lacing.

Aroma: Very chocolaty and creamy aroma, almost like Cookies & Cream with chocolate syrup. Very light roasted bite, molasses and coffee.

Taste: Much milder, and harsher, than the aroma indicated, but maybe the aroma was a little too much to live up to. Strong roasted malts, with some coffee, molasses and chocolate. However, there is a sweet, creamy undercurrent that helps to balance the roasted bite.

Palate: Moderately low carbonation, very creamy body but slightly chalky, but it really improves as it warms. A little bit warming.

Overall: Very smooth and creamy Stout. I had expected a titch more from the aroma, but that is a minor gripe. Better than One, not as good as Tres. Awaiting Fore and The Fifth.

Pours black with thin sudsy beige head. Aroma is all milk chocolate with a hint of dark fruit and licorice. Taste is sweet creamy dark malt, roasty bitterness in the finish.  Nice palate which is not too thin or thick, great milk stout

Bottle @ home, courtesy of bushmat1. Thanks Matt! Thick, deep black appearance with no head retention. Chocolate, milk sugar, raisin, dark malty nose. Kind of light bodied. Nice milk sugar, chocolate, light espresso, fig, raisins, roasty dark malty flavor. Chocolate, milky, coffee aftertaste. One of the best sweet stouts Ive ever had.

I was skeptical with the whole Dark Horse stout series thing but as an avid stout fan, I dove in head first glad I did! This is the second in the "stout series" and maybe the best. Excellent mouthfeel, strong flavor and aroma. Loved it all around.

Bottle, $2 single at Famous Liquors. Pours pitch black,with a bubbly head the color of black walnut stain. Smell has molasses sweetness and definite chocolate roast malt to it. Taste is beautifully big on chocolate, with a milky texture. Deep stout flavor, but with some noticeable hop balance in play. Thick and sticky,with a slow alcohol warming. Its heating up outside,and Im hunkered in the basement lightening my cellar while typing away and popping this baby open.Things can get better.

12oz bottle poured into glass. Very dark pour, thick and creamy. Aroma is full of chocolate, a lot of milky lactose sugar abounds as well. Sweet flavor with hints of coffee and toffee. Carbonation is a little bit high for this style but doesnt ruin the experience.

Chocolate malts, burnt cookies. Touch of oily hazelnut. Akin to an Imperial Stout. Outstanding.

Appearance is uber-dark brown; nearly black. Half finger of cardboard brown head.

The flavor is dusty hazelnuet and mocha chocolate. Boozy finish. Dates and raisins. Cocoa.

Palate is dry, dusty finish. Perfect for style. Dry, burnt, nutty, boozy. Almost an Imperial stout. Really excellent.

Bottle. Pours oily black with a dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, mild coffee, light chocolate and a hint of vanilla. Smooth and creamy flavor of roasted coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, a touch of vanilla and a hint of smoke with a roasty dry finish.  Decent brew

bottle, from trade with Barleypops. consumed 4/20/11. Ok aroma, roasty, bitter chocolate, little vineous. Dark brown color, no head or lace. Bitter flavor. Lite body, oily smooth mouthfeel, bitter finish, OK, Im more surprised this held up as well as it did, I thought it was gonna be past. Trade was back from May 2009. But was good, not memorable, but all things considered, solid.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Draft @ Radio Maria. Verydark brown, tan ring. Roasty aroma and flavour, creamy smooth as promised with equal parts earthy roast, coffee, andbitterchocolate. Dry finish. Classic.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Reviewed from notes.

Poured into a snifter. Pours a very, very dark brown color. Nose brings forward some lightly roasted malt as well as a bit of sugar. Some coffee and chocolate pervade, but are certainly in the background. The taste is pretty plain without much other than a bit of roast. The feel is a bit dry, but has a nice body with the lactose. Drinks quite well overall, though theres not much that stands out about it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-09-2010

Too smoky and burnt for a cream/milk stout. Not remotely sweet. Very rauchy. (smoky)

Did I mention burnt, and smoky?

Okay, it looks pretty good. Great froth and the color is jet black with coffee head.

But the first sip is riduculously dry and bitter for a cream stout. YES, there are lactaids here. But its overshadowed by the coffee, dry bitterness.

Embrace if you like coffee porters or really dry stouts. A great example of either a dry stout, Java porter, coffee stout etc.. Just not a cream stout. Its just classified poorly.

Not a fan.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a jet black color with a thin tan head.  Aroma is chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt.  Creamy mouthfeel on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, chocolate, roasty.  A very nice sweet stout.

Poured pitch black with a dark tan head.  Head did not last and there was no lacing to speak of.  Nose was heavy coffee and chocolate.  Taste very much followed the nose on this one but add in some burnt sugar or molasses.  Mouth feel was creamy and quite enjoyable.

12 oz bottle from PA. Pours deep black in color with little to no head. Nice roasted aroma with slight coffee notes. Nice medium body with slick silky mouthfeel. Slight roasted notes balanced with slight chocolate notes and roasted coffee. Overall: (B+)

Pours heavy and black with a quickly shrinking dark brown head. The aroma is latte, fudge, black licorice, and roasted malt. The flavor is very rich with tons of ashy, roasted malts, creamer, coffee, fudge and a big roasted finish. Good balance with the sweet chocolaty malts and the big roasted finish. A creamy mouthfeel adds to the pleasure of this brew.
ive got to be honest, this tasted very similar to the oatmeal stout...not sweet enough to be a cream stout in my opinion, but still very enjoyable.

Bottle from my bro thanks ck1.  Pours an opaque black with a foamy chocolate milk brown head.  Aroma is roasted malts with some vanilla.  Taste is bittersweet chocolate, roasted malts and some saltiness.  Somewhat thin for a stout.  Finishes medium long with more bitterness.  Dark Horse continues to be very solid up and down.

The roasted coffee bean aroma is powerful and rich. In the background is a nice dark chocolate. The head is a fast-fading medium brown. The liquid is as dark as space itself. Roasted coffee beans are the primary factor in the flavor. Sugary chocolate is in there, too, but to a lesser extent than in the aroma. The palate is covered with a mild burn of carbonation, covered quickly by the sheer weight of the creamy brew. Roasted coffee makes up the entire aftertaste, but it is mild. If youre in the mood for coffee but want the buzz, this is your guy.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured thick, black and oily with medium sized creamy very dark brown head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was bitter, roasty and toasty with light notes of coffee, vanilla, chocolate and wood. The flavor was toasty, roasty and bitter with notes of wood, nut, coffee and cocoa. The finish was long, dryish, smoky and roasty with some lingering coffee. Thick and full bodied. Solid
Bottle thanks to generous trader. Pours oily black. Brown head. Nose and taste of chocolate milk, smoke, peaty ash, roasted chocolate malts and roasted coffee beans.

Black pour great looking dark tan head ....  aroma is lactose low roasted coffee .....  taste is nice roasted and coffee  chocolate cocoa and sweet lactose but smooth and creamy with a dry roasted coffee finish .... Great looking and tasting brew abv hidden well

Received in trade from Davolebomb, thanks for the opportunity.
Pours a solid black color, even a vigorous pour could not coax much of the tan head out of hiding. Smells of roasted malts, huge amounts of coffee and ash on the nose. Sweet lactose burnt sugar, dark caramel in there as well. Taste is what I expected. Hugely roasted malts with burnt coffee, ash, and a lactose sweetness that barely balances any of the roast. Wow this is the most "burnt" brew I think Ive ever tasted. Reminds me of that coffee pot that got left on the burner empty for too long. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, thick body, light level of carbonation. Kudos to Dark Horse for pushing the burnt boundary. This one actually grew on me as I drank it, its not something I would drink all the time, but Im glad I got to try it.

Bottle. Pours jet black with very little, dark brown head. The aroma is a lot of roast and chocolate. The flavor follows the nose but adds coffee to the mix. The finish is a nice roasted bitterness. The mouthfeel is creamy.

Pours black with a small tan head. Almost no head to be honest, I had to force it. Leaves a nice film of bubbles when you swirl it around the glass slowly.
Coffee, malty, and a bit of chocolate. Some slight hint of vanilla. Dark fruits, but not strong in them. There is something a bit off as well. Its not a bad thing, just doesnt seem like it belongs. Kind of like a slight sourness, like a wood aged beer. But I have to search it out and it doesnt detract from the overall experience.
Diluted roasted malt. Slight sweetness with a big bitterness on the back end. Some coffee, but mostly the tannins making it bitter. Strange for a cream stout.
Slightly creaminess that is soon overshadowed by the bitterness that bites hard and sticks around. Not very cream stout like.
Fairly drinkable minus the shortcomings. I would try it again. But when I want a cream stout I will pass this one up. More of an American style dry stout.

Pours black, but not as thick as some. Creamy brown head.  Nose of coffee, lactose, vanilla and nuts. A bit of smoke in the taste rounds out the coffee-nuttiness.  Medium-heavy mouth-feel with smoky bakers chocolate finish.  Very good, but not my cup of tea.

Bottled. Black colored. Small quickly diminishing brown head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, spice and mild roast. Flavor of light roast, sweetness, light herbs, some spice and chocolate. Quite subtle and balanced. Medium to full bodied. Dry creamy end. Light roasty bitterness.
Very well made stout, the lactose gives a very creamy thicky body making this a very drinkable stout, roasted malts and blurred with this mouth feel, highly recommended

Thick black pour like motor oil drained after 5000 plus miles.  Tan head with an aroma of roasted malt, hops, and chocolate.  Roasted malt, chocolate and hops  flavor.  Well done. Creamy mouth feel.  Very nice!

Bottle. Oily black pour with nice dark tan brown head that fades to a collar.  Aroma is smokey and roasted malt with some soy. Taste is more smoke and roasted malt with a chocolate soy flavor on the finish. Palate is full and fizzy with a chaulky finish.

12oz bottle. Dark pour with a creamy dark head that did not stick around too long. Thin yet oily mouthfeel. Sweet malty aroma with chocolate and coffee tastes. No alcohol taste whatsoever but after 12 ounces I do believe its there.

This poured a dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma was nice roasted notes, light chocolate, and light hops too. Flavor was very silky smooth and creamy light chocolate, some darker bitter chocolate and medium roast. Overall a very nice simple sweet stout.
Bottle purchased from Tiffanys in Kalamazoo, Mich., and poured into a pint glass.  A nice cream stout, very sweet.  Notes of chocolate and coffee evident.  A nice Dark Horse offering.

A deep dark stout with a thin brown head. A nice expresso coffee aroma with wood extract, quite nice. In mouth, a smooth chocolate malt with light coffee, herbal notes, very nice, medium bodied. On tap at Sunset Grill, Jan. 16 2011.

This creamy stout has a burnt popcorn (or malt) aroma that is not unpleasant by any means.  The appearance is dark and velvety with a very thin light cream cloroed head.  The taste, oh the taste!  Dark colored coffee beans and malts roasted over a campfire.  The palate enjoys a smooth stout celebration and a nice after taste.
I didnt think the mouthfeel was particularly creamy, but the taste is very good, with notes of coffee and chocolate. Very dark brown in color, with a thin, medium brown head.

A sweet stout at 8%, heheh, somebody is stretching the limits here pal!  On tap at the house of 1000 beers in neew ken, nice place. BIg black pour with an appearance that cant be beat, it has one of the darkest heads that Ive ever seen. It holds and its so creamy looking I stick my tongue into the choco moose. Mild coffee aroma. Milder than expected. Smooth yet is is just a tad bitter choco or black coffee bitter. Still, very enjoyable. One of the better coffee flavor beers Ive had, nice and gentleman like. Barely any CO2 but I didnt notice that until the end.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12oz bottle served in a tulip pour was black with two fingers of some of the darkest head i have seen in a brew with average lacing. Nose was big coffee,chocolate and hazelnut creamer. Taste was chocolate,cream and peat with a strong coffee finish. Light in body with good mouth feel a solid brew in all regards.

12oz bottle served in a tulip.  Pour is onyx with two fingers of cocoa head; this one has a bit of lacing, but excellent retention!  Nose is big coffee, coffee creamer, vanilla, hazelnut, and roasted malt.  Taste is creamy black coffee with a flavor shot of vanilla and hazelnut.  This stuff is could easily double as a cold coffee beverage before a craft beer.  Not only is the ABV hidden with cunning stealth, the body is as a light as a feather, and the taste comes off like a Java House treat.  This could make a true "breakfast" stout!

Pours a very dark, near black brown with a slight reddish tint and a foamy dark brown head. Great aroma, roasted malts, lots of chocolate, a little burnt coffee, touch of hops. Flavor is coffee, Cocoa and cream with a smooth, sweet Malt, and a roasted smoky finish. And a touch of hops to even things out. I think for a Cream Stout, this has more "Bite" than usual. But still a very good stout.

Pours black into a shaker. Creamy dark brown head with medium retention recedes laving spot lacing. Sweet hot chocolate aromas. Creamy sweet chocolate and espresso turning to soy in the middle before the lasting, slightly hot, dry mocha finish.
Served in snifter.  Not much witha great rich coffee/ soy sauce smell.  Smooth dark chocolate with a bitter finish.

Pours jet black with puffy dark brown head that quickly settles to a wispy covering on the beer. Aroma is sweet and roasty. Coffee, chocolate, and, well, it smells a bit like chocolate ice cream. Full bodied and coats the mouth with cocoa and that milk sugar sweetness. Very good beer.

This is totally satisfying my craving for dark beer this time of year. Very entertaining melted chocolate and slight roasty aroma. Mouth feel is pretty full bodied. Very, very long finish that leaves the roastiness on the back of your throat and the sweetness on your lips. Mid palate is creamy milk chocolate goodness. An easy to drink and incredibly appetizing stout.

Pours a dark, dark, reddish brown, asymptotically approaching black. An interesting head of reddish-brown foam, never seen that one before. Aroma is yeasty and of roasted malts, coffee, and dark chocolate, maybe even a hint of licorice. Taste is much the same as the aroma -- coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts. Very creamy and smooth.  Could be just a bit more sweet but otherwise great.
Black it is.  Roasted malts leap out at first with.  Medium bodied but a thin taste.  Roasted malts are also in taste but with chocolate and vanilla.  A creamy sweet finish.

Purchased at Archer Liquors in Chicago, IL; enjoyed while watching the Bears vs. Packers game.  Appearance is a pure black with motor oil consistency, very thin coffee-tan head.  Aroma rich in chocolate and lactose, with notes of roasted malts.  Also slightly nutty.  Taste is very creamy, primarily lactose and chocolate, very decadent, also slightly boozy.  Pretty good stuff.

On tap at the local option; pour is dark brown with tan head; a bit modest with average retention and lacing. Nice roasted chocolate malts on the nose . It kicks off with the toasty chocolate notes but the lactose sugars come into play immediately. Sweet and sour, but so nice. Better than moloko? Its close for sure

Bottled. Quite much pitch black colour with not too much head. Aroma is vanilla, roasted malts, alcohol, some chocolate, coffee as well as some slight notes of fudge. Flavour is quite much the same with some mild acidic notes. Vanilla, roasted malts and some chocolate as well.
(bottled and shared with oh6gdx) black colour with slight disappearing brown head. coffee and milk(?) on nose. very sour taste. bottle can be rotten?

12 oz bottle.  Pours a deep dark rich pitch midnight black- typical "dark horse blackness"  always some of the blackest stouts on earth- thin lasting dark toffee head.  Aroma is nutty earth, dusty caramel and dark chocolate malts, sweet sugary, cream, lactose, sugary chocolate candy, dusty herbal woodiness as well.  Flavor is ashy, roast, big bittersweet chocolate with sweet lactose, leather, earth, good body, big, and holds up very well to age- this bottle is a couple years old and is still really nice!

12/18/10.  12oz bottle thanks to fata2683 - thanks, Keith!  Big roasted malt aroma with sour peanuts in there, too.  Sweet roasted malts in the flavor with chocolate and a hint of ashy meatiness.  Nice!
12 oz bottle. Pours thin, black.  Not much head.  Nice roasted malt aroma and taste.  A little sweet.  Really drinkable stout!
Bottle courtesy of wnoble.  Very dark brown pour, short dark tan head.  Milk chocolate, lots of roasted malt, and a touch of vanilla sweetness.  A tasty stout, glad to try.
Pours black with a tan head. The aroma has chocolate, coffee, cream and strawberry. The flavor is similar to the aroma. Not bad, but I prefer one.s

12 oz. bottle from International Beverage in Grand Rapids, MI.  Pours black with virtually no head.  The lactose is very detectable in the aroma immediately upon removing the cap.  Closer inspection notes dark chocolate on the nose and mixed with the lactose comes off as milk chocolate.  The flavor is like a shot of espresso with notes of dark roasted coffee beans, semi-sweet chocolate, and hints of dark fruit on the finish.  The alcohol is barely noticeable.  Overall this is a well done stout.
Bottle from Ølbutikken. Small head with short duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, milk, vanilla, chocolate and hops.

Black and zero head. Nose is fruity esters, roasty, chocolatey, coffee, and maybe a little sweet sourness. Taste is sweet malt, roast, coffee, malts, smoke, and some fruity esters. Quite bitter and balances the bitterness nicely. Great sweet stout. 
(null)
Head: minimal
Initial: heavy bitterness, light sourness
Finish: heavy bitterness, medium bitterness
Body: full
Texture: oily, slick, dry

bottle thanks to StFun, pours black with a medium dark brown head.  Aroma is sweet cream, bitter cocoa, and roasted coffee.  Flavor is bold and roasty.  Bitter cocoa, charcoal, tobacco, burnt sugar.  Only semi-sweet in the finish.  Damn good sweet stout!
Great. Smooth tasty, smokey, chocolate. Could be a little more flavor, but is decently drinkable.

Bottle, 12oz. A black beer topped by a small, tan head. Coffee, chocolate and a little sourish touch on the nose. Theres a little milky-sour touch in the flavor too, but its mostly coffee and chocolate. Full-bodied and dry. As One, I think this one too lacks on hops, especially in the bitter. It feels a bit one-tracked as it is, but its still a very fine beer. 100521
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt. Flavour is sweet, coffee, hop, roated malt. full bodied nice beer.

Picked up at Sicilianos in Grand Rapids. Totally black, small dark brown cap with little lacing. Man - I do not dig the aroma - its very strong, reminds me of burnt milk and something metallic with underlying chocolate. That chocolate is quite dark and grows with warmth but, still, not my thing. The taste is much better but pretty much has the same characteristics of the aroma just in a backwards order. Lactose, dark roasted malts, tons and tons of medium powered chocolate, nutty, sweet and a pleasant bitterness. Really good! Dont think more than a pint would be good for me though. Soft carbonation and the bitterness leave a neat feel and very light tartness. I dont get a thick coating left over because the perfect kind of bitterness wipes it away somehow. No notice of the alcohol. Excellent dark milky chocolate aftertaste. I think I went wrong here by dumping in a good chunk of the sediment because it was just so harsh for the first while. I hope that was what was up. Great chocolate taste. Chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate chocolate
Very creamy and sweet. Definite chocolate taste, with a little coffee and alcohol at the finish. Filling. Great brew.
Bottled. A pitch black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of roasted malt, leading to a dry roasted finish.

Serious black with red around the edges.  Very little head, light carbonation.  Coffee, roasted malts, background hint of the lactose.  Dark, bitter chocolate/coffee.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Lingering roasted aspects.  Bitter, dry finish from the malt.  Could use a touch more sweetness to showcase the "cream" aspect, but extremely good stout.  I would venture to say this is my favorite of the 5 stout set thus far, with only Tres remaining to try.  Something about the Dark Horse stouts that are just raw and gritty - love it!

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish roasted malty creamy chocolate aroma. Sweetish malty chocolate flavor with some roasted hints. Has a sweetish roasted malty chocolate finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a black body with a thin, dark brown head that dissipates quickly and leaves a moderate lacing. Aroma is creamy dark chocolates and some lactose milk chocolates with a nice, soft and sweet roast to balance. A hint of plummy sourness and charred smoke. Flavor is similar. Some hard roasted, sweet malts with a touch of acidity balance nicely with dark chocolates and some lactose milk chocolates. A light plummy fruitiness with some coffee and cream. Finishes dry with a light-moderate, coffee-roast-bitterness with a light astringency and plummy sourness as well as a solid chocolate, malty sweetness that leaves a lengthy aftertaste. Medium-full body with a moderate, creamy, lively carbonation. Overall, a solid cream stout. Roasty with plenty of chocolate malts and a nice, creamy lactose. Good one.

picked up a 4 pack from the store next to the brewery. Arouma is roasty dark chocolate, espresso. Roasted, chocolate malts, licorice and molasses. Beautiful dark black pour and thin brown head good lacing. Notes of earthy, bitter root. Leaves hints of bitter astringency on the tongue. Nice balance, smooth bodied.
Amazing aroma. Chocolate and expresso like scent. The flavor doesnt really live up to the scent, but overall very tasty. Great after taste!!!

Draft. Pours opaque black, HUGE dark tan head, great lacing. Nose is chocolate, sweet cream, light fruit. Flavours are remarkably similar to a black forest cake, chocolate gateau, whipped cream, cherries, etc. Damned nice!
Aroma: chocolate, coffee. Appearance: black, minimal head, brown foam. Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness. Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish.

Bottle courtesy of CanIHave4Beers.  Cheers, Andy!  Pours dark black with tan head.  Nose is sweet and chocolatey, with some toasted marshmallow notes.  Tastes a little more one-dimensional and thinner, but with some added chicory notes.  Nice super dry palate.  Very good.
Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a weak chocolate colored head. The aroma is roasted, coffee and licorice. The flavor is very close to the nose. The palate is dry. Overall a good beer.

Served on draft at Bridgids.

Pours pitch black and completely opaque with a thick frothy dark mocha head that slowly fades into a lasting ring. Streaks of chunky lacing left behind.

Slightly toasty/roasty aroma with lots of bittersweet dark chocolate and toffee balanced by a sweet lactic cream presence. Hints of roaste esppresso bean and burnt toast hut thisnis nicely balanced out bythe cream character in the nose.

Chewy, slightly viscous medium body with toasty malts as well as hints of bittersweet dark chocolate, toffee, oatmeal, burnt toast and slight nut flavor. There is a sweet lactc cream/milky presencethat balances things out and makes this beer very quaffable. Slightly hoppy with subtle spice. Very complex.

This one pours a pitch black color and topped by a small, tan colored of head of foam that receds quickly leaving a sudsy wash behind. The nose shows notes of rich, dark chocolate and roasted coffee along with some sweetness from lactic cream to balance all that roast. The flavor shows more of the bitter dark chocolate and roasted coffee along with some lactic sugars that adds some creamy sweetness. Full bodied and creamy as you would expect with fine carbonation that goes down very smoothly with a bitter-sweet finish. Im not a huge fan of cream in beers, but this is a solid stout.

(bottle - 12 oz) Oil black with a creamy tan head. Roasted malts, coffee and chocolate dominate the aroma with just the slightest hint of cream. Flavor is more roasted at the start. The cream doesnt really add much to the flavor, but seems to just tone down the roasted aspect of it. Finishes with a light sweetness that balances out the roast. A bit thin-bodied.

Very dark brown pour with a small light brown head that leaves almost no lacing.  Aroma has a it of chocolate with some roasted undertones, taste is quite similar but with more malty flavors coming through.  All in all this is a good beer and a nice representation of the style.  Something I would drink again...

This is a great looking beer w/ its deep black oily texture and tan head of uniformly small bubbles which remains the duration and coats the glass w/ sheets of lace w/ each sip. Aroma is mild and chocolatey and there is a soft hing of an oxidized coconut note in the background. This has a dense and mildly vinous dark fruit character but its not as thick or as heavy as you might expect in, say, an imperial stout. The carbonation is mild w/ small, beady bubbles that roll across your tongue and finishes w/ a mild roasty bitterness in the finish. It all comes together reasonably well but it is one of those beers that I feel they could have gotten the same amount of flavor from a carefully constructed five or six percent alcohol beer.

A: The flavor is essentially black with a mild mocha colored head on top.

S: There is a lot of coffee to the nose of this beer. A strong roasted malt note as well, as a light creamy sweetness.

T: The sweetness is not as pronounced as most cream/milk stouts. Still, the sweetness that is there provides a nice balance to the strong coffee and bitter chocolate.

M: The body is medium with a creamy and moderate level of carbonation.

D: One of my favorite styles, and this is a bit of a different interpretation of it. I really enjoyed the strong coffee and slight creaminess.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Utterly black with a tiny, staying, creamy, dark-brown head. Aroma has lactose, roasted malts, milky chocolate, light grainy. Light vinious. High carbonation, surprisingly thin texture. Flavour is at first rather weak because of the lack of body. Hard roasted malts, milky chocolate and a hint of lactose peeping through. Lots of dryness. Really a weird beer... is it infected? Dont think so. I just dont think they know how to control the lactose - and the lactic acid that follows.
Black with a small brown head. Aroma of licorice and ink, with ham-like smoke. Sweetish roasted flavour with burnt notes.
Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, plum and raisin. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate and coffee.

Bottle @ Odense Tasting, April 2010. Pours pitch black with a small off white head and lacings. Nose is butter, chocolate, oat and mild roast. Smooth and roasted flavor with a bit of cold coffee. Sticky and oily. Dry roasted end.

12oz bottle.  Pitch black with a deep brown, almost purple head, that quickly fades away.  Sweet sugary chocolate aroma, soft and pleasant.  This really nails the style, capturing the sweet pungency while displaying an awesome chocolate malt creaminess.  The alcohol is not even a factor, complements the richness.  Somewhere between a session Stouts and Imperial Stouts, Dark Horse has found an interesting niche to delve into.  Good stuff, world class.

Too (of four) purchased at Tiffanys in K-Zoo last summer.  Aroma has a considerable amount of roasted malt, some smoke and a bit of marshmallow to it.  The flavor has the slight big of creaminess to it but is mostly a good solid stout.

Bottle 12fl.oz. @ home.Dark black color, sparkling short, with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, burnt, dark chocolate, light vanilla. Flavor is light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, chocolate, dark berry acidic and sweet. Body is medium, texture is watery and creamy ! carbonation is soft to flat. [20100406]
Roasted barley and caramel aroma with just a hint of smoke. Roasted coffee flavors with hints of milk chocolate sweetness. A simple, but solid stout.

Pours black with a tall tan head.
Rich malt aroma that carries cocoa powder, dark caramel and some vanilla to the nose.
Nice mild sweetness without the usual bitterness that many stouts have; all the while not being cloying in any way.
Smooth easy drinking.  Very nice.

Flaske: Kulsort øl med et lille skumhoved. Duft af sød malt, smagen er underlig subdued. Med 8 % er det en ordentlig skuffelse med så lidt saft og kraft. Ingen bid og næsten ingen brændthed. Skuffende, men ok øl.
Medium black pour with darker tan head. roasted malt, milk, milk chocolate. well balanced with smooth creamy mouthfeel. Flavor is chocolatey & roasty. 2 for 2 in the series

Fløska. Pitch black. Aroma: dark fruits, roasted malt, chocolate, some alcohol and liquorice. Flavour. Pepper and lots of roasted malt, roasted caramel, light sourness detected. Good but with a small infection .

Bottle pours a pretty much black with a small tan head.  Aroma of dark chocolate, graham crackers,  roast.  Toasted creamy bitter chocolate.  Nice sticky creamy mouthfeel.  I was concerned this would be too sweet (bc i sometimes find sweet stouts with lactose sugar to be too sweet) but i should have never doubted dark horse for a moment.  Lots of roast and bitter chocolate notes to balance this out nicely.  Tried all 5 of the dark horse stout series.  Gotta say, they all exceeded expectations.  great, underappreciated stouts all around.

12oz bottle via trade thanks to dug on BA.  Pours pretty much black with a one-finger beige head.  Aroma is roasty and fairly chocolatey with some coffee notes.  A little sweet.  Flavor is similar to the aroma, with roast, chocolate, and coffee.  Lactose sweetness is definitely noticeable.  Some considerable earthiness in this one as well.  Mouthfeel is somewhat grainy and perhaps a little more carbonated than Id like this style to be.  Body is medium-full.  This is an excellent stout overall.  Dark Horse has really come up as a dark horse recently and has put out some awesome beers.

bottle shared by faroeviking
black , small brown head.
aroma is licorice, dark caramel, borwn sugar, very nice sweetish aroma. promising...
flavor is salty, sourish, licorice, roasteed grains, slightly infected im afraid, or perhaps intentionally a little bit tart?
12 ounce bottle dark black pour brown head. taste smooth extra creamy chocolate, great beer

Pours like a dark motor oil. Roasty, chocolatey with a slight bitter finish. Held up to a light, you can just barely see through it. Pretty good. I like the smoked stout from Dark Horse a lot more...just a bit more exciting.

Very dark beer out of the bottle with a foamy dark brown head.  Big roast grain nose wih some sweet chocolate syrup notes.  Lots of roasted grain flavors with dark chocolate, coco puffs and chocolate pudding.  Slick mouthfeel.  Very nice beer.  Thanks to mpetersen for sending this bottle my way.
Small hops aroma, thick off white head, VERY roasty w/ creamy mouthfeel.  Filling.  Dry finish.  Quite good.

Bottle. Black/brown with moderate, quickly dissipating brown head. Chocolate, molasses aroma with a hint of prune. Flavor was sweet chocolate with a hint of spice and smoke, winding down to a pleasant roasty bitterness.. Smooth creamy mouth feel with a bit of carbonated tingle and a slight tannic finish. I really enjoyed this stout, and am glad I picked up a 4 pack.

12 ounce bottle.  Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch brown head.  Head retention is good, lacing is decent.  Aroma is sweet and malty, the beer smells like milk chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla and some toffee.  Taste is similar to the aroma, but I can also notice a bit of coffee in the flavor.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit chewy and coating with good carbonation.  Drinkability is good, its not hard to drink at all and its smooth.  The 8% ABV isnt very noticable at all, youd think you were drinking a beer that wasnt quite as strong as it really is.  I thought this was a good overall brew.  This was also the last beer in the Dark Horse Holiday Stout series that I hadnt tried until now.  I have to say all of them are good!
Black with a big thick brown head. Aroma of roasted malts and milk chocolate.  Taste of medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish.

Slightly thick dark opaque pour with a very dark tan head that dissipates after a few seconds.   Roasty aroma.  Very dry bitter roast flavor with a nice deep creaminess.  Hints of chocolate.  Nice beer.

Pours thick, black and beautiful with a light brown head eventually forms a quarter inch ring around the top. The aroma is full of heavy roast, chocolate, and  coffee. Maybe a hint of anise. The flavor is similar of course, with a sweet start, and a bitter finish. Nice creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. I liked this one better than the "One Oatmeal Stout". Similar, but better palate.

Pours dark black with a wispy brown head that gathers around the edge of the glass. The nose is smoke, lactose, and light chocolate malt. Medium body, pillow like texture across the tongue, and finishes sticky. The taste is sweet upfront with a smoky bitterness in the end that softens as the beer warms.  Overall the beer is quite drinkable. There is a surprising smokiness, almost beef jerky like. It improves as it warms. My least favorite of the five winter stouts from Dark Horse.

Bottled. Black coloured. Small quickly diminishing brown head. Aroma of sweetness, lactose, chcolate, spice and mild roast. Flavour of light roast, sweetness, light herbs, some spice and chocolate. Qutie suptle and balanced. Medium to full bodied. Dry creamy end. Light roasty bitterness.
